snippet: Bill shock is usually rare in restaurants, but the Haggler finds that it may be a recurring phenomenon at a spot in Manhattan.
abstract: David Segal The Haggler column finds bill shock may be a recurring phenomenon at Nello restaurant in New York; relates that one diner was charged $275 for pasta with truffle sauce.
lead_paragraph: Bill shock is usually rare in restaurants, but the Haggler finds that it may be a recurring phenomenon at a spot in Manhattan.
